io.craigmiller160.stockmarket.model

Class PortfolioModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.craigmiller160.mvp.core.AbstractPropertyModel
      • io.craigmiller160.stockmarket.model.PortfolioModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Portfolio, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SQLPortfolioModel

    @ThreadSafe
 @MappedSuperclass
public class PortfolioModel
extends io.craigmiller160.mvp.core.AbstractPropertyModel
implements Portfolio
    A JavaBean bound property model storing the values defining a stock portfolio in the StockMarket program. These values are the portfolio's name, its cash balance (the amount of money available to buy stocks), the value of the stocks in the portfolio, the list of those stocks, the net worth, and the change in that net worth since the portfolio was created.

    THREAD SAFETY: While this model is completely thread safe, extra care must be taken with the stock list property. It can be leaked from this class via the getter method or the PropertyChangeEvent fired by its setter. The leaked reference must be properly synchronized when either iterating or modifying it. Synchronization should be done on the list's intrinsic lock. Not-iteration reads do not need locking, as this list is a synchronized collection.

    Version:
    2.2
    Author:
    craig
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • setInitialValue

        public void setInitialValue(java.math.BigDecimal startingCash)
        Set the initial values of this portfolio. This method should be invoked immediately after creating a new portfolio model instance, as it overwrites all other values based on the starting amount of cash provided as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        startingCash - the starting amount of cash for the portfolio.

      • setStockList

        public void setStockList(java.util.List<OwnedStock> stockList)

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        public void setNetWorth(java.math.BigDecimal netWorth)

      • setChangeInNetWorth

        public void setChangeInNetWorth(java.math.BigDecimal netWorthChange)
        Sets the change in net worth since this portfolio was created. This is calculated by comparing the current net worth to the starting cash balance. This is a bound property, and a PropertyChangeEvent is fired when it is changed.
        Specified by:
        setChangeInNetWorth in interface Portfolio
        Parameters:
        netWorthChange - the change in net worth since this portfolio was created.

      • setCashBalance

        Specified by:
        setCashBalance in interface Portfolio
        Parameters:

      • setStockInList

        public void setStockInList(OwnedStock stock)
        Sets the specified stock in the list. If the stock parameter is not in the list, it's added to it. If the stock is in the list, it replaces the existing instance in the list. If, however, the stock parameter has 0 shares and matches a stock in the list, then its match is simply removed.
        Parameters:
        stock - the stock to be set in the list.

      • getStockInList

        public OwnedStock getStockInList(OwnedStock stock)
        Get a stock from the list, a match for the stock passed to this method.
        Parameters:
        stock - a stock with the same symbol as the stock to retrieve.
        Returns:
        the stock that matches the stock parameter, or null if there is no match.

      • getStockInList

        public OwnedStock getStockInList(java.lang.String symbol)
        Get a stock from the list, based on its symbol.
        Parameters:
        symbol - the symbol of the stock.
        Returns:
        the stock from the list, based on its symbol, or null if the stock doesn't exist.

      • getStockInList

        public OwnedStock getStockInList(int index)
        Get a stock from the list, based on the index number.
        Parameters:
        index - the index number of the stock in the list.
        Returns:
        the stock from the list.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index parameter is not a valid index for the stock list.

      • getStockListSize

        public int getStockListSize()
        Get the current size of the stock list. This is the number of stocks owned by this portfolio.
        Returns:
        the size of the stock list.

      • getStockList

        public java.util.List<OwnedStock> getStockList()
        Returns the list of stocks owned by this portfolio.

        To maintain thread safety, the stock list returned is a shallow copy of the one guarded by this class's lock. The elements in the list are shared references, though. If the OwnedStock implementation is not thread safe, then additional synchronization measures will be needed.

        Specified by:
        getStockList in interface Portfolio
        Returns:
        the list of stocks owned by this portfolio.
